intro: Parosela laevigata, commonly known as the smooth parosela, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are smooth and glossy, often arranged in pairs along the stem. Parosela laevigata is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests and understory habitats.
